The identified loop structures in the given program are as follows:

1. Line 13: `for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)`

The loop iterates as long as `w` is non-zero. It initializes `w` to 3, decrements `w` by 1 in each iteration, and continues until `w` becomes zero.

Therefore, the identified loop lines are:

```
{
  "target_list": [
    "for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)"
  ]
}
```

```json
  "program": "unsigned fn6(unsigned p1, unsigned p2) { return p1 - p2; }\n\nunsigned p;\nint t;\nlong v;\nshort w;\nshort ac_value = 1;\nint main() {\n  int an;\n  for (w = 3; w; w -= 1)\n    if (an = 250) {\n      t = ac_value || (an = w) == 0x294A85636008822DL;\n      short ao = 0xBCD1;\n      if ((ao - (fn6(1, an) - 0xECL)) - t & 1)\n        v = 1;\n    }\n  p = v;\n  printf(\"checksum = %X\\n\", p);\n  return 0;\n}"
}
```
